category.term: Star Wars Uncut: The Director's Cut
category.label: Topic

content.div:
Some two years ago, a group of Star Wars die-hards decided to remake Star Wars: A New Hope out of fan-generated scenes. That long-awaited project has finally come to fruition with a Director’s Cut, a two-hour+YouTube video created entirely by crowdsourcing.

Encouraged by organizer Casey Pugh, fans were asked to recreate the Star Wars movie in 15-second segments and were given free-reign to do whatever they wanted. Video editor Aaron Valdez and sound designer and mixer Bryan Pugh selected what they thought were the best submissions of the bunch and put together the following Director’s Cut, a unique re-creation of the original George Lucas film. Since then, the video has gone viral.

Have a look for yourself.

source.title: Crowdsourced 'Star Wars Uncut: The Director's Cut' goes viral

entry.title: On TV's Million Dollar Neighbourhood, Aldergrove families open their wallets for the world to see

link.Abstract: Facing crushing debt, would you expose your family and its finances to the unflattering glare of reality TV? One hundred households said yes.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: 'Million Dollar Neighbourhood' co-hosts, Bruce Sellery and Joti Samra. Families had to learn to communicate about their finances, which, along with sex, is something most couples struggle to talk about.
link.title: Million Dollar Neighbourhood

link.Abstract: In the debt-ridden town of Aldergrove, the community is teams up for a million dollar challenge that could change their fortunes forever as they attempt to increase their net worth by a million dollars in three months.
link.title: Photos: Scenes from Million Dollar Neighbourhood

link.Abstract: Calgary financial expert stars in reality show on Oprah's network
link.title: Million dollar man

link.Abstract: Watch the trailer for the realty TV series that takes place in Aldergrove, B.C.
link.title: Video: Million Dollar Neighbourhood trailer

entry.title: Legenday R&B singer Etta James dies

link.Abstract: Legendary R&B singer Etta James - famous for her hit songs "At Last" and "Something's Got a Hold on Me" --has died, according to TMZ and other news sources
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Singer Etta James in concert at the Festival International de Jazz de Montréal in 2006.
link.title: Singer Etta James

link.Abstract: Grammy-winning blues and soul legend Etta James, famous for her hit At Last, was taken off respiratory assistance but remains hospitalized in California, her agent said Friday.
link.title: Singer Etta James off respirator, still in hospital

link.Abstract: Dr. Elaine James, who is no relation to the singer, told a California newspaper in a video interview that the 73-yearold At Last singer has leukemia, dementia and kidney disease among her "many, many illnesses."
link.title: Singer Etta James terminally ill: doctor

category.term: Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and Museum
category.label: Organization

entry.title: New movies this week: A Separation, Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close, Haywire and more

link.Abstract: Asghar Farhadi’s film A Separation deals with an unfamiliar culture but still maintains its accessibility.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Simin (Leila Hatami) and Nader (Peyman Moadi) are an Iranian couple seeking a divorce in a small but powerful film, A Separation.
link.title: A Separation.

link.Abstract: Iranian drama is now in theatres.
link.title: Photos: Scenes from A Separation

link.Abstract: See the latest trailers for A Separation, Haywire, Coriolanus, Red Tails, and Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close.
link.title: Videos: Watch trailers for all of this week's new releases

link.Abstract: African-Americans always got second billing in the Second World War, as well as in its ancillary propaganda, so it only seems fair to have a movie like Red Tails join the calcified annals of highly mediated Yankee war imagery.
link.title: Film review: Red Tails shot down by clichés

link.Abstract: Hollywood take on 9/11 attacks suffers from a lack of emotion
link.title: Film review: Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close, and yet pretty vacant

link.Abstract: As the first mainstream Hollywood movie to tackle the tragedy of 9/11 head-on, this story based on the novel by Jonathan Safran Foer takes us into the very private world of Oskar Schell (Thomas Horn), an outsider kid who loses his father on the day Lower Manhattan fell.
link.title: Photos: Get Extremely Loud and Incredibly Close

link.Abstract: Veteran Max von Sydow and newcomer Thomas Horn are an odd couple.
link.title: Veteran von Sydow masters the art of speaking without words

link.Abstract: Soderbergh film showcases butt-kicking talents of former mixed martial arts fighter Gina Carano
link.title: Film review: Haywire: Tough thriller hits the target

link.Abstract: Ewan McGregor is a jack of all acting trades. And that’s not a reference to the fact that McGregor stars in a re-working of the fairy tale, Jack the Giant Killer, out this summer.
link.title: Interview: McGregor throws himself fists-first into role of special agent

link.Abstract: Action movie is now in theatres.
link.title: Photos: Scenes from Haywire

link.Abstract: Film version of play finds its stride on film thanks to superb cast
link.title: Film review: Fiennes finds heart of Bard’s Coriolanus

link.Abstract: Although Oscar winner Stanton experiences sense of liberation while filming Martian tale by Tarzan author
link.title: Like his main character, director has an awakening in the desert

entry.content: Asghar Farhadi’s film A Separation deals with an unfamiliar culture but still maintains its accessibility.
